1.text: Let the charity of the brotherhood abide in you.

2.text: And hospitality do not forget; for by this some, being not aware of it, have entertained angels.

3.text: Remember them that are in bands, as if you were bound with them; and them that labour, as being yourselves also in the body.

4.text: Marriage honourable in all, and the bed undefiled. For fornicators and adulterers God will judge.

5.text: Let your manners be without covetousness, contented with such things as you have; for he hath said: I will not leave thee, neither will I forsake thee.

6.text: So that we may confidently say: The Lord is my helper: I will not fear what man shall do to me.

7.text: Remember your prelates who have spoken the word of God to you; whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation,

8.text: Jesus Christ, yesterday, and to day; and the same for ever.

9.text: Be not led away with various and strange doctrines. For it is best that the heart be established with grace, not with meats; which have not profited those that walk in them.

10.text: We have an altar, whereof they have no power to eat who serve the tabernacle.

11.text: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the holies by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

12.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people by his own blood, suffered without the gate.

13.text: Let us go forth therefore to him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

14.text: For we have not here a lasting city, but we seek one that is to come.

15.text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise always to God, that is to say, the fruit of lips confessing to his name.

16.text: And do not forget to do good, and to impart; for by such sacrifices Godâ€™s favour is obtained.

17.text: Obey your prelates, and be subject to them. For they watch as being to render an account of your souls; that they may do this with joy, and not with grief. For this is not expedient for you.

18.text: Pray for us. For we trust we have a good conscience, being willing to behave ourselves well in all things.

19.text: And I beseech you the more to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

20.text: And may the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the great pastor of the sheep, our Lord Jesus Christ, in the blood of the everlasting testament,

21.text: Fit you in all goodness, that you may do his will; doing in you that which is well pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom is glory for ever and ever. Amen.

22.text: And I beseech you, brethren, that you suffer this word of consolation. For I have written to you in a few words.

23.text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty: with whom (if he come shortly) I will see you.

24.text: Salute all your prelates, and all the saints. The brethren from Italy salute you.

25.text: Grace be with you all. Amen.
